title: Simple HTML DSL
description: Build a tiny DSL for generating HTML strings using Kotlin's lambda with receiver pattern.
instructions: Create a buildHtml function with a lambda receiver on StringBuilder. Add helper functions tag() that wraps content in HTML tags. Generate and print a simple HTML snippet.

hints.text: Use StringBuilder.() -> Unit as the receiver lambda type
A tag function appends <tag>content</tag> to the builder
Use buildString { } or StringBuilder() as the entry point

commonMistakes.correction: Use StringBuilder.() -> Unit for the lambda type
Always append both opening and closing tags
buildHtml should return the built String
